alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sheridan and northern Gove Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Grinnell, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Sheridan and northern Gove Counties, including the following locations... Angelus and Seguin. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 81 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds associated with this storm may result in areas of reduced visibility associated with blowing dust. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
